meanings.definition: Smooth out a wrinkle in (something, especially fabric).
meanings.sent1: She carefully unwrinkled the shirt before ironing it.
meanings.sent2: After washing and drying, the clothes unwrinkle nicely.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to unwrinkle the blanket by pawing at it playfully.
meanings.sent4: His apology helped unwrinkle the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: Using a warm iron can effectively unwrinkle the tablecloth.

meanings.definition: Become smooth or free of wrinkles.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the paper will unwrinkle itself if left undisturbed.
meanings.sent2: The fabric starts to unwrinkle as soon as you hang it up.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the fabric unwrinkle in an instant.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to unwrinkle the worries from his face.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun helped unwrinkle the petals of the flower.
